content:
The sentence "she \_\_\_\_ always\_\_\_\_\_ to bring her books" requires two verbs to be grammatically correct. To make a complete sentence, you could fill in the blanks with the verbs "is" and "forgetting".

* She "is" always "forgetting" to bring her books.

Alternatively, you could use different verbs, as long as they make sense in the sentence:

* She "has been" always "neglecting" to carry her books.
* She "always seems" to "have trouble" remembering her books.

It depends on the context and what you want to convey with the sentence.
